metadata.title: CVE-2021-33833 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
ConnMan (aka Connection Manager) 1.30 through 1.39 has a stack-based bufferoverflow in uncompress in dnsproxy.c via NAME, RDATA, or RDLENGTH (for A orAAAA).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33833` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

connman - 1.41-2
connman-vpn - 1.41-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: connman package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.41-2').
